abstract: Only 350 miles separate the two California business cultures, but executives are once more trying to bridge the gap between technology and entertainment.
snippet: Only 350 miles separate the two California business cultures, but executives are once more trying to bridge the gap between technology and entertainment.
lead_paragraph: A story that Daniel Scheinman, a senior vice president at Cisco Systems in San Jose, Calif., likes to tell illustrates the cultural divide between Hollywood and his Silicon Valley.

abstract: A new study by a search marketer suggests that Yahoo’s search ad business grew faster than Google’s business in the United States in the first quarter. The study by SearchIgnite represents just one of the many data points that investors will be watching for signs of an economic slowdown and the value of the Microsoft-Yahoo deal.
snippet: A new study by a search marketer suggests that Yahoo’s search ad business grew faster than Google’s business in the United States in the first quarter. The study by SearchIgnite represents just one of the many data points that investors will be wa...
lead_paragraph: If the results of a study by SearchIgnite, a search advertising technology firm, prove representative of the broader search market, something unusual happened in search ads in the first quarter: Google lost share to Yahoo in the United States.

headline.main: Study: Google Lost Share of Search Ad Dollars to Yahoo

abstract: It has been a brutal time for companies hoping to go public, with a record number of initial public offerings being withdrawn in the first quarter of 2008. This makes the proposed stock sale of DigitalGlobe, a provider of satellite earth images whose customers include the United States government and Google, all the more interesting. Late Monday, the Longmont, Colo.-based company filed to sell as much as $250 million in stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
lead_paragraph: It has been a brutal time for companies hoping to go public, with a record number of initial public offerings being withdrawn in the first quarter of 2008. Late Monday, the Longmont, Colo.-based company filed to sell as much as $250 million in stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
